titles.title: Oregon Inlet Protection Act of 1993
A bill to require the Corps of Engineers to carry out the construction and operation of a jetty and sand transfer system, and for other purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S678)
Introduced in the Senate. Read the first time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under Read the First Time.

calendar.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 20.

bill.summary: 1/26/1993--Introduced. Oregon Inlet Protection Act of 1993 - Directs the Secretary of the Army to construct, operate, and maintain the jetty and sand transfer system for the Oregon Inlet on the coast of North Carolina, subject to specified requirements, limitations, and modifications. Exempts such action from any permit requirement prior to the use of such system.
